text: (Very very fast)Cons:1) The camera is not as good as it was expected.
The macro lens is pretty useless, and the main camera lacks depth and the colors aren't as vibrant as OnePlus 8.
4K video recording @ 60fps is absent but 1080@60fps performance is quite good.

(The camera is better than most phones out there but it isn't what we were promised)2) No headphone jack.3) The mono speaker is on the bottom right of the phone, which tends to get covered by your hand while using.

Also, being on just one side of the phone, the audio isn't as well delivered as it is on a stereo speaker.4) No expandable memory slot.5) The plastic frame (doesn't look like plastic but it is) is a worrying thing and makes the phone *comparatively* less durable.6) Fingerprint scanner being under the screen isn't as quick as a traditional fingerprint scanner on the back.Recommendation: If you're looking for a phone which delivers high performance and smooth interface for your daily use, go for it.But if your prime purpose is gaming, there are better options available.Also, if you're expecting flagship camera performance, you might want to consider other phones.
(Pixel 4a is about to release, that's far better probably)Update: Pixel 4a camera is surely much better that Nord's camera.
While i am still exploring the phone, the one aspect that is a complete let down is the camera.
Most phones these days look and feel alike with the camera being one aspect that sets the winners apart from ordinary phones...i dont know what you guys did here.

The phone that I had received, I used it for about 2 weeks and discovered it had this image retention issue.
The afterimage of anything displayed for a period of time on the phone for a long time is displayed on the screen even after the original image is pulled off.

This could be seen while watching Youtube videos in non-fill screen mode or videos that have any kind of frame visible or even games like PUBG where static elements of game like the map's frame or your controls would be visible on certain background colours even after you have turned the game off.
The image retention issue could easily turn into permanent screen burns really soon.

Received my OnePlus 8 pro (12GB+256GB) today and it is an absolute beast  thanks to Amazon for fast delivery and also 3k discount using SBI credit card.ProsSnapdragon 865 best chipset available for AndroidStunning 120hz displayExcellent battery life30watt warp chargeWireless chargingIP68 ratingImproved camera quality5g supportUFS 3.0 storageBest in class Android skin (Oxygen OS)No display issues in Indian unitsConsphotochrom filter disabled ( I really wanted to try that one )Curved edges cause accidental touches ( I hope they will fix it in new update)Overall a true flagship from OnePlus

Don't buy this phone!oneplus company released fake updates for color filter camera in which camera is useless and not taking images like before.Its totally useless now which forces us to take pictures outdoor only.And all new updates give more issues, no hearing from oneplus side and they are just ignoring.I attached old and new camera photochrom filter images.

It wasn't expected from one plus,I am facing the same issue which is experienced by most users on one plus 8 pro ,something which is called black bar issue near front facing camera when brightness of the phone is set to low,really not expected one plus.

The phone was good but the display was so BAD with so many issues like Red Tint (120hz), Green tint (at 60hz), Black Bar beside camera, Image retention.Returned mine, this was my First and LAST oneplus phone.
OP3 earpiece volume had deteriorated very much over time.- Rear Camera has improved a lot, but I can already feel that there are still rooms for improvement.
Also, the camera bump is quite prominent.- I did not find any green tint or black crush issues as reported by some International users as of now.
But I can see a black bar running parallel to front camera module under the lowest brightness setting.

Also, watch YT videos in landscape mode.- Lack of the 3.5mm headphone jack is the biggest let down for me in this phone.I'm yet to test a lot of things, will update after a few days of usage.Writing the review from my new OP8 Pro, it just feels great.
I dont play any games, my phone usage is mainly social media, instagram,facebook,reddit, twitter and bunch of other photo edit tools like lightroom and snapseed.
I bought the oneplus 8 pro selling my DSLR camera so that I can record all my videos on phone itself plus its waterproof.
Recently I shot a video at 4k 60fps and I guess within few minutes the phone got so heated that it disabled the camera from video shooting until the phone cooled down!!

Now whats the use if I cant record a video even for few minutes straight on 4K?Camera - To be honest, stabilization is really great while recording video however photos are almost as good as oneplus 5 if not slightly better.
Video clarity is really great, far better than the oneplus 5.

I bought OnePlus 8(8 GB variant ) in Glacial Green on 29th May 2020 and received it on 2nd June 2020.As a OnePlus product, we are bound to expect Strong performance, fast charging, good battery backup, decent camera quality, and overall smooth user experience.

And I can say that One Plus has not lead us down again.The touch is super smooth, face unlock is fast as a blink of an eye, I constantly use google assistant which response pretty well, I am blown away with the camera quality and audio quality that is powered by Dolby Atmos.Apart from the strong base of hardware and software the phone has some pretty cool features that I have been loving for instance Digital Wellbeing, Work-Life Balance mode, Quick reply in landscape ,Zen Mode, customization for each application that helps in optimization and intelligent functioning.The phone connects pretty fast to wifi and Bluetooth devices.
I have used this phone for my online meetings as well, the screen renders images and videos pretty well.All in all this a great deal and I highly recommend buying this phone.

Its been one week since i am with Oneplus 8, hope this is right time to write down whats good and whats been missed from my earlier deviceBeen a samsung s8 user for 3 years, its right time to upgrade and my search from beginning of this year end up with Oneplus 8Its been wait for 6gb variant and even a DM to OP team didnt helped in identifying sale date of 6Gb varient, then made my my mind for 8GB, reason i felt i am okay with 6gb is because i am not a person to play game in mobile rather use ipad for sameNow the bests:- Sceptic about downgrade of QHD screen to FHD+, surprised the screen quality is impressive- Size factor, smaller 5.8 to 6.55inches to my longer hands it is perfect enough- Sound, far better than S8- Just to give a try on game tried asphalt 9 it is buttery smooth- Battery - pretty impressive, charges constantly in 1hour time, gives 2 full days with Screen on time around 5-6 hours, in one week just charged 3 times- 90HZ to say it is awesome- Camera looks decent for my usage, have to see when i do prints- No complaints on curved screen may be i am used to it last 3 years, so op8 screen looks better too with curvesCons:- first 2 days had issues with Wifi, it was getting turned off automatically once i dont get phone in hand for some hours,not sure it was adopting to usage, now it looks normal- Glacier green from certain angles looks fadedMissing from Samsung S8:- Now have to worry about getting devices in rains of Bangalore- Samsung pay definitely a best of misses, never carry wallets earlier- So many sensors like heart rate, step counts, Health app etcOverall at current market this device looks good for the money spent, will post future experiences too after some time

Camera:OnePlus5 also comes bundled with a dual camera setting.

While the front camera is of 8-megapixel, the two rear cameras are a combination of a 16-megapixel lens and a 20-megapixel telephoto lens.Both the lens is made by Sony and the primary camera has an aperture of f/1.7 while the secondary camera has an aperture of f/2.6.
The telephoto lens will offer up to 2x zoom and both the lenses will combine together to capture impressive photos with a greater depth of field, akin to the portrait mode of the iPhone 7 Plus.3.

The mobile display on the screen has vanished and no images are visible on the screen even when the instrument was used sparingly  for watching videos on you tube since it was delivered to me on 28th June(only two months back).

(Using 8 GB ram variant)∆ WHAT'S INSIDE THE BOX ∆The box looks like any other mobile phone box , nothing much fancy .Inside the box we get1) Device itself2)User manual and some paperwork.3)Dash charger and cable.∆ PROS∆1) Design-It's a pro or con depending on each user's, if you look pass the Appleish design the build quality is amazing .It has curved back which feels really good when you hold it in hand.2)Top notch specs.3) Stock Android with minimal bloat and fast updates (I have received 3 till now)4)No-heating issues-I have used this device for many days and I must say this device barely heats up while doing intensive tasks, thanks to the Snapdragon 835.5) Excellent Camera-Day light photography is excellent but in low light it's a hit or a miss.6)Fast fingerprint scanner.∆CONS∆1) Display is still Full hd2) Battery is not that great even with Full hd display (This could be fixed with an  software update)3)No Sd card slot.4) Price could have been less.Overall Iam pretty happy with the device and I highly recommend this to anyone over honor 8 pro.Thanks ✌️

text: So this review is considering 6800 cost...Pros.1) good features considering cost 6800.2) Size matters 6.5 inch grt3) Speakers are good Dolby4) Comes with classic headphones with good looks and decent sound quality... No other phones now a days comes with headphones...5) Quad camera gives good quality photos...6) Selfie camera is also decent considering cost 68007) 5000mAh battery8) can be use as power bank for other phonesCons:1) Original cost 13990 is huge considering features...Other good brands like MI, VIVO, MOTO, etc sells 48MP camera phones for 12000 and so...2) Accessories like back cover, tempered glass are yet not in market... May be u have to wait for them...Though 1 transparent back cover is included in Mobile Box...This is all about this phone after 24hrs use....I will update if something comes...

Best option for exchange, I got it in 9k ,Review score (out of 5)Design : 4.5 (finger print scanner position is bit high), other things like screen size, corners,back panel, camera position are perfect and it's light weight too...Sounds quality : 5/5 (unexpected, dual side stereo and Dolby is awesome, loudness, clarity and effects are far better then any other phone i.e.

mi 7 pro, Lenovo, Samsung or honor)Photography : it's similar to other available options in market, day light as usual is very clear and crisp, didn't get time for more night photography, but few repetitive uploaded pics are in night mode with very minimal light which are good.Battery backup : best in this category (10% ~ 3 hours of heavy uses) , for heavy uses 30hours for normal uses it ll go up to 2 days.Performance : not played many games but seems good, while opening any game auto memory cleaner will run,lag and heat issue is not there (checked continuously 1.5 hours)Memory space : 46 GB free space, all basic apps are pre installed, separate as card slot is available (apart from 2 SIM slot), 1.86 GB ram available after all updation, while playing any game also 900 to 1 GB space is availablePros : apart from above mentioned points :1)Front cam is good like other similar phone (mi, real me, honor, Samsung)2) earphones quality/look is very good in this range.3) dual speaker position is in front top of display and near to charging pin, so stereo comes properly4)face detection is fast5)no heating issue while charging /YouTube /gaming6) battery is lasting for more than 4 days on normal usesCons:1) fingerprint scanner position is bit high2) ram 6 GB would have a perfect option3) macro photos are not that good compare to redmi 7 pro4) no fast charger with pack

text: Overall this phone is a good competitor against chinese manufacturers.PROS:--Supports fast charge and has pretty decent charge rates-Has NFC which enables in wireless payments and support for Android Beam (unless Android 10 comes)-Has a good 4000mAh battery, pretty decent for bit of heavy users-Has on-screen fingerprint which is good-Camera setup is goodCONS:--Camera struggles to shoot better pictures at night-The included night mode requires a little bit software upgrade-OneUI which is extremely good, but the icons are kind of kiddish-And mostly- Where is Bixby voice assistant?There is bixby home though but this phone does not support Bixby voice assistantOverall the cons are not a big factor.Most of the cons are fixable by latter FOTA upgradesSo if you are looking for a budget option, go for itThis is my review after using the A30s for 3 months.
model: Samsung Galaxy A30s (Prism Crush White, 4GB RAM and 128GB)

text: So this review is considering 6800 cost...Pros.1) good features considering cost 6800.2) Size matters 6.5 inch grt3) Speakers are good Dolby4) Comes with classic headphones with good looks and decent sound quality... No other phones now a days comes with headphones...5) Quad camera gives good quality photos...6) Selfie camera is also decent considering cost 68007) 5000mAh battery8) can be use as power bank for other phonesCons:1) Original cost 13990 is huge considering features...Other good brands like MI, VIVO, MOTO, etc sells 48MP camera phones for 12000 and so...2) Accessories like back cover, tempered glass are yet not in market... May be u have to wait for them...Though 1 transparent back cover is included in Mobile Box...This is all about this phone after 24hrs use....I will update if something comes...

Best option for exchange, I got it in 9k ,Review score (out of 5)Design : 4.5 (finger print scanner position is bit high), other things like screen size, corners,back panel, camera position are perfect and it's light weight too...Sounds quality : 5/5 (unexpected, dual side stereo and Dolby is awesome, loudness, clarity and effects are far better then any other phone i.e.

mi 7 pro, Lenovo, Samsung or honor)Photography : it's similar to other available options in market, day light as usual is very clear and crisp, didn't get time for more night photography, but few repetitive uploaded pics are in night mode with very minimal light which are good.Battery backup : best in this category (10% ~ 3 hours of heavy uses) , for heavy uses 30hours for normal uses it ll go up to 2 days.Performance : not played many games but seems good, while opening any game auto memory cleaner will run,lag and heat issue is not there (checked continuously 1.5 hours)Memory space : 46 GB free space, all basic apps are pre installed, separate as card slot is available (apart from 2 SIM slot), 1.86 GB ram available after all updation, while playing any game also 900 to 1 GB space is availablePros : apart from above mentioned points :1)Front cam is good like other similar phone (mi, real me, honor, Samsung)2) earphones quality/look is very good in this range.3) dual speaker position is in front top of display and near to charging pin, so stereo comes properly4)face detection is fast5)no heating issue while charging /YouTube /gaming6) battery is lasting for more than 4 days on normal usesCons:1) fingerprint scanner position is bit high2) ram 6 GB would have a perfect option3) macro photos are not that good compare to redmi 7 pro4) no fast charger with pack

The phone arrived today.There is a considerable amount of bloatware - MI apps/junk.The build quality is medium - mostly plastic.The camera is also not bad but it blurs and does applies beautify filters, which I am sure I don't like, have to turn this off, or the pictures look unnatural.The display seems to be crisp enough, and the phone itself is pretty snappy (right now).Call quality is crisp, I don't have VoLTE in my locality though.The Green and Greener look is nice.The phone charges really fast.Like I mentioned earlier, the phone arrived today, so I am not sure how the phone will age.There are other good phones in this category that offer very much the same, for instance the Moto One Power, which would definitely have less bloatware.Overall, considering this is a phone that will be used moderately - It is not bad.Except for the bloatware!
model: MI Poco M2 Pro (Green and Greener, 6GB RAM, 64GB Storage)

So great camera quality is one of my main priority, after using it now I must say that it has the best camera available in this budget.It’s plastic made but mirror finish back panel is the coolest thing in my blue colour device.
With the brand tag line of Vivo “Camera & Music” it really impressed me.I’ll surely recommend my fellow buyers to buy this cool device.

But there is also something which can be improved so writing it in bullet points for your ease..Pros:-● It’s really a 100% value for money device.● Run on latest version of Android “9”.● In Box soft back cover and tempered glass.● Dedicated kid mode for safety against unwanted operational activity of kids● Finger print sensor in back of the device is at perfectly placed in the reach of fingers and open the device faster.● 5000Ah battery, allows to watch many hours online video● HD+ screen Resolution and balanced colour contrast makes the viewing experience really pleasure and never hurt eyes● Triple camera with AI and image editing options are among the best features for me● Fast charging support with 18 watt inbox adaptor● Snapdragon 665 processor is really a power pack performer even in multitaskingCons:-● Lags in PubG (However in a device with 4 GB it’s expected as the game itself take 2 GB space)● No headphones included● Front Camera struggles in low light.At the price of 10990 its a great phone for better multitasking.
